reviews.title: Ultimate choice
reviews.text: This buffet is great. If you aren't staying at the Grand, plan to eat at this lunch. You can use your "entrance fee" to the Grand toward this lunch. Eat late and you won't need dinner.
While it was not one of the best restaurants, it was one of the best buffets I've dined at. The ambience, service and overall experience makes it worth at least a one time experience.
reviews.title: Really lovely buffet from someone who is not a fan of buffets.

reviews.text: While touring The Grand Hotel, we wanted to experience some of their food. In a choice between the Afternoon Tea or Lunch Buffet, there is only a $5 difference.........so the Lunch Buffet it was! (BTW, the Afternoon Tea looked to be held in a main Lobby of The Hotel, so it's not exactly intimate or private.) We were in line at 11:40am, and they opened the dining room promptly at Noon. We were stoked to get window seats and a table for just the two of us. The food was fancier than a country buffet, but I'm sure it wasn't as fancy as the fare you'd get for breakfast or dinner. That being said, it was an experience I do NOT regret. The service was wonderful - our Waiter was quite attentive. He also not only volunteered to take our picture, but he tried to tweak the lighting and our poses to get a fantastic pic. Yes, the dining room was likely 98% tourists, but that's just what it is at that time of day. Overall, it's an experience you should try, if your budget allows. It was a nice surprise that the tip and tea/coffee were included in the price.
reviews.title: Worth the Experience -- arrive early!

reviews.text: ... a few nice touches thrown in, shrimp, oysters, smoked whitefish, etc. The setting and the service make it special, but for the most part there's nothing really special on the buffet line. Plus, it's crowded with tourists. Opt for The Jockey Club just across the street for lunch, or The Woods (both are owned by the hotel) for dinner.

reviews.text: Lunch at the Grand Hotel is for the experience, not the food. As many other reviews point out, the food is average. I will add, however, that the really ripe tomatoes and strawberries were out of this world. I almost made my $41.80 lunch out of the fruits!
reviews.title: Oh The Strawberries and the Tomatoes
